results.title: Weather forecast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
International cooperation in weather forecasting. Radio communications system controlled by the World Meteorological Organisation of the United Nations. Numerous examples of how weather forecasting can reduce or eliminate the danger and damage of hurricanes, gales and high tides. Weather studies in the reclamation of desert areas.

results.title: Weather does its thing
results.creator_credit: United Nations, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Selig Alkon
results.brief_description: The film looks at the human relationship to climate and shows how in the past we have changed our weather for the worse. The World Weather Watch is followed and the interchange of facts taking place between the World Weather Watch Centres at Washington, Moscow and Melbourne is seen. The significance of WWW is explained by David A. Davies, Secretary-General of the World Meteorological Organisation.

results.title: Weather diary #5
results.brief_description: The latest chapter’ of the remarkable Weather Diary series finds Kuchar observing his personal, social and natural environment with wry humor and introspection. Writes Kuchar:Set in central Oklahoma during May, I spend 3 weeks in a motel and get talked at by a small weather-radio that seems to rule my life. I, myself, get to talk at the lady who runs the motel and who runs a cosmetic empire downtown. The viewer gets to see her equipment and her corner of the world as storms lurk somewhere off-camera, waiting to enter stage left and bring down the house. This is one of the more social installments of the weather diary series’.

results.title: Wear resistant metals
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, S.T. Evans and Peter Bruce
results.brief_description: Between two and four hundred million dollars are spent in Australia each year on replacing metal equipment work by abrasion, impact and erosion. One way of preventing wear is by coating metal components with wear-resistant alloys. The choice of the appropriate alloy is based on a thorough understanding of its performance in particular situations and the influence of temperature and corrosive environments on it.

results.title: Wealth of a nation
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and William Greaves
results.brief_description: Illustrates that individual expressions of freedom of action and thought in all areas of life - social, economic and political - are evidence of the strength and progress of a nation. Citizens of all walks of life are shown in pursuit of their own area of thought and action.

results.title: Wealth in wood
results.brief_description: The story of Gold Coast (Ghana) timber, the country’s third largest industry, employing 10,000 people and having an annual turnover of 7,000,000 pounds. A world demand for fine hardwood timber is met, while making a major contribution to the development and prosperity of the Gold Coast.

results.title: Wealth from water
results.brief_description: Surveys progress made on the Snowy Mountains Hydro-Electric Scheme up until 1953. Chronicles the work which has preceded production of the film, including excavations, maintaining communications and supplies during the winter months, living conditions for workers, as well as an overview of the aims of the scheme and the amount of power it will ultimately supply.

results.title: Wealth from coal
results.creator_credit: Realist Films and Edgar H. Anstey
results.brief_description: A study of the varied and versatile by-products of coal, which include: tar, constituents for explosives, disinfectants, plastics, dyes and sulfa drugs.

results.title: We were just too young
results.creator_credit: MTI Teleprograms, J. Gary Mitchell and John McDonald
results.brief_description: Janice and John were teen parents at 15 and 18, and two years later the reality of their situation has shattered their dreams. We see how their bad decisions and unrealistic expectations now weigh heavily on their lives and their 2 year old son’s.

results.title: We want goods and services
results.brief_description: Uses children’s experiences to show that people all want many things, that some are goods and some are services, that everyone is a consumer, and that it takes many people to produce goods and services. Suitable for lower secondary level.
